histogram("") == {}

#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>

map<char,int> histogram(string test){
    map<char,int> m;

        if(m.find(test[i])==m.end()){
            m[test[i]]=1;
        }else{
            m[test[i]]+=1;
        }
    }
    return m;
}

Could you please explain why my code doesn't work? <|/ c |> <| c |> Your code doesn't work because you didn't understand how `std::vector` works. You can't just copy the vector and expect it to work. `std::vector` doesn't copy the contents of its argument to the vector, it just copies the pointer to the first element of the vector. Thus, when you do `vector v2 = v;`, you just copy the pointer to the first element of the vector `v` to the vector `v2`. Then, when you do `v2.push_back(x);`, you just add `x` to the vector `v2`, but you never change the contents of `v`. You have to do `v2.push_back(x);` instead. Also, don't use `using namespace std;`, it's bad practice. <|/ c |> <| c |> Thank you so much! I understand it now. Also, thank you for the advice on using namespace std. */
#include<stdio.h>
#include<string>
#include<map>
using namespace std;
bool check_dict_case(map<string,string> dict){
    map<string,string>::iterator it;
    for(it=dict.begin();it!=dict.end();it++){
        if(it->first.size()==0){
            return false;
        }
        if(it->first.at(0)!=toupper(it->first.at(0))){
            return false;
        }
        if(it->second.size()==0){
            return false;
        }
        if(it->second.at(0)!=toupper(it->second.at(0))){
            return false;
        }
    }
    return true;
}
